title: Chelsea news: Frank Lampard praises surprise names after Christian Pulisic hat-trick
text:
Frank Lampard was thrilled after another Chelsea win (Picture: Getty Images)

Christian Pulisic may have bagged a hat-trick in Chelsea’a 4-2 win over Burnley, but manager Frank Lampard was keen to single out Mateo Kovacic and Jorginho for praise.

The Blues were in fine form at Turf Moor as the American scored three and Willian grabbed the fourth in a largely dominant victory over Sean Dyche’s side.

The away side looked to be coasting to victory before two late goals from Jay Rodriguez and Dwight McNeil made things a little edgy, but they held on for their seventh straight victory in all competitions.

As he became the youngest player in Chelsea history to score a hat-trick, Pulisic has grabbed most of the headlines, but Kovacic and Jorginho really caught Lampard’s eye in central midfield.

‘Absolutely delighted [with the performance] I’d be the first to criticise sloppy endings and sloppy goals but I can’t today because I don’t want to take away from what the performance was, which was fantastic.

‘It’s a really tough place to come, we knew all the threats, how difficult they make it for you.

Jorginho battled hard in midfield against Burnley (Picture: Getty Images)

‘Some of the play, some of the football, I’m sure we’ll talk about Christian [Pulisic], but [Mateo] Kovacic and Jorginho in midfield, their confidence on the ball, receiving the ball with pressure coming, the way they played.

‘I’m delighted with 95% and that’s enough for me, I’m really pleased.’

Jorginho and Kovacic have become central figures in the Chelsea midfield, especially the former, who has started all 10 Premier League games and all three Champions League games this season .

It was another fine display from Lampard’s side as they pick up their seventh win on the spin in all competitions and remain fourth in the Premier League.

Rampant in front of goal, they have now scored 23 times in 10 games, with only Manchester City and Leicester scoring more than the Blues so far this campaign.
